publisher.publisher-name: Chinese Academy of Mathematices and System Sciences (AMSS) Chinese Academy of Sciences

title-group.article-title: THE ELLIPSOID ARTIFICIAL BOUNDARY METHOD FOR THREE-DIMENSIONAL UNBOUNDED DOMAINS

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2009 AMSS, Chinese Academy of Sciences

abstract.p: The artificial boundary method is applied to solve three-dimensional exterior problems. Two kind of rotating ellipsoids are chosen as the artificial boundaries and the exact artificial boundary conditions are derived explicitly in terms of an infinite series. Then the well-posedness of the coupled variational problem is obtained. It is found that error estimates derived depend on the mesh size, truncation term and the location of the artificial boundary. Three numerical examples are presented to demonstrate the effectiveness and accuracy of the proposed method.
